an4.125:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, these four individuals are found in the world.

an4.125:1.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo mettāsahagatena cetasā ekaṃ disaṃ pharitvā viharati, tathā dutiyaṃ tathā tatiyaṃ tathā catutthaṃ. Iti uddhamadho tiriyaṃ sabbadhi sabbattatāya sabbāvantaṃ lokaṃ mettāsahagatena cetasā vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena abyāpajjena pharitvā viharati.
an4.125:1.3.eng: Firstly, an individual meditates spreading a heart full of love to one direction, and to the second, and to the third, and to the fourth. In the same way above, below, across, everywhere, all around, they spread a heart full of love to the whole world—abundant, expansive, limitless, free of enmity and ill will.

an4.125:1.4.pli: So tadassādeti, taṃ nikāmeti, tena ca vittiṃ āpajjati.
an4.125:1.4.eng: They enjoy this and like it and find it rewarding.

an4.125:1.5.pli: Tattha ṭhito tadadhimutto tabbahulavihārī aparihīno kālaṃ kurumāno brahmakāyikānaṃ devānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjati.
an4.125:1.5.eng: If they abide in that, are committed to it, and meditate on it often without losing it, when they die they’re reborn in the company of the gods of the Divinity’s host.

an4.125:1.6.eng: The lifespan of the gods of the Divinity’s host is one eon.

an4.125:1.7.pli: Tattha puthujjano yāvatāyukaṃ ṭhatvā yāvatakaṃ tesaṃ devānaṃ āyuppamāṇaṃ taṃ sabbaṃ khepetvā nirayampi gacchati tiracchānayonimpi gacchati pettivisayampi gacchati.
an4.125:1.7.eng: An ordinary person stays there until the lifespan of those gods is spent, then they go to hell or the animal realm or the ghost realm.

an4.125:1.8.pli: Bhagavato pana sāvako tattha yāvatāyukaṃ ṭhatvā yāvatakaṃ tesaṃ devānaṃ āyuppamāṇaṃ taṃ sabbaṃ khepetvā tasmiṃyeva bhave parinibbāyati.
an4.125:1.8.eng: But a disciple of the Buddha stays there until the lifespan of those gods is spent, then they’re extinguished in that very life.

an4.125:1.9.pli: Ayaṃ kho, bhikkhave, viseso ayaṃ adhippayāso idaṃ nānākaraṇaṃ sutavato ariyasāvakassa assutavatā puthujjanena, yadidaṃ gatiyā upapattiyā sati.
an4.125:1.9.eng: This is the difference between a learned noble disciple and an unlearned ordinary person, that is, when there is a place of rebirth.

an4.125:2.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, idhekacco puggalo karuṇāsahagatena cetasā …pe…
an4.125:2.1.eng: Furthermore, an individual meditates spreading a heart full of compassion …

an4.125:2.3.pli: upekkhāsahagatena cetasā ekaṃ disaṃ pharitvā viharati, tathā dutiyaṃ tathā tatiyaṃ tathā catutthaṃ. Iti uddhamadho tiriyaṃ sabbadhi sabbattatāya sabbāvantaṃ lokaṃ upekkhāsahagatena cetasā vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena abyāpajjena pharitvā viharati.
an4.125:2.3.eng: equanimity to one direction, and to the second, and to the third, and to the fourth. In the same way above, below, across, everywhere, all around, they spread a heart full of equanimity to the whole world—abundant, expansive, limitless, free of enmity and ill will.

an4.125:2.4.pli: So tadassādeti, taṃ nikāmeti, tena ca vittiṃ āpajjati.
an4.125:2.4.eng: They enjoy this and like it and find it rewarding.

an4.125:2.5.pli: Tattha ṭhito tadadhimutto tabbahulavihārī aparihīno kālaṃ kurumāno ābhassarānaṃ devānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjati.
an4.125:2.5.eng: If they abide in that, are committed to it, and meditate on it often without losing it, when they die they’re reborn in the company of the gods of streaming radiance. The lifespan of the gods of streaming radiance is two eons.

an4.125:2.6.pli: Ābhassarānaṃ, bhikkhave, devānaṃ dve kappā āyuppamāṇaṃ …pe… subhakiṇhānaṃ devānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjati.
an4.125:2.6.eng: … they’re reborn in the company of the gods of universal beauty. The lifespan of the gods of universal beauty is four eons.

an4.125:2.7.pli: Subhakiṇhānaṃ, bhikkhave, devānaṃ cattāro kappā āyuppamāṇaṃ …pe… vehapphalānaṃ devānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjati.
an4.125:2.7.eng: … they’re reborn in the company of the gods of abundant fruit.

an4.125:2.8.pli: Vehapphalānaṃ, bhikkhave, devānaṃ pañca kappasatāni āyuppamāṇaṃ.
an4.125:2.8.eng: The lifespan of the gods of abundant fruit is five hundred eons.

an4.125:2.9.pli: Tattha puthujjano yāvatāyukaṃ ṭhatvā yāvatakaṃ tesaṃ devānaṃ āyuppamāṇaṃ taṃ sabbaṃ khepetvā nirayampi gacchati tiracchānayonimpi gacchati pettivisayampi gacchati.
an4.125:2.9.eng: An ordinary person stays there until the lifespan of those gods is spent, then they go to hell or the animal realm or the ghost realm.

an4.125:2.10.pli: Bhagavato pana sāvako tattha yāvatāyukaṃ ṭhatvā yāvatakaṃ tesaṃ devānaṃ āyuppamāṇaṃ taṃ sabbaṃ khepetvā tasmiṃyeva bhave parinibbāyati.
an4.125:2.10.eng: But a disciple of the Buddha stays there until the lifespan of those gods is spent, then they’re extinguished in that very life.

an4.125:2.11.pli: Ayaṃ kho, bhikkhave, viseso ayaṃ adhippayāso idaṃ nānākaraṇaṃ sutavato ariyasāvakassa assutavatā puthujjanena, yadidaṃ gatiyā upapattiyā sati.
an4.125:2.11.eng: This is the difference between a learned noble disciple and an unlearned ordinary person, that is, when there is a place of rebirth.

an4.125:2.12.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmin”ti.
an4.125:2.12.eng: These are the four individuals found in the world.”

an4.126:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, these four individuals are found in the world.

an4.126:1.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo mettāsahagatena cetasā ekaṃ disaṃ pharitvā viharati, tathā dutiyaṃ tathā tatiyaṃ tathā catutthaṃ. Iti uddhamadho tiriyaṃ sabbadhi sabbattatāya sabbāvantaṃ lokaṃ mettāsahagatena cetasā vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena abyāpajjena pharitvā viharati.
an4.126:1.3.eng: Firstly, an individual meditates spreading a heart full of love to one direction, and to the second, and to the third, and to the fourth. In the same way above, below, across, everywhere, all around, they spread a heart full of love to the whole world—abundant, expansive, limitless, free of enmity and ill will.

an4.126:1.4.pli: So yadeva tattha hoti rūpagataṃ vedanāgataṃ saññāgataṃ saṅkhāragataṃ viññāṇagataṃ te dhamme aniccato dukkhato rogato gaṇḍato sallato aghato ābādhato parato palokato suññato anattato samanupassati.
an4.126:1.4.eng: They contemplate the phenomena there—included in form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness—as impermanent, as suffering, as diseased, as a boil, as a dart, as gloom, as an affliction, as alien, as breaking apart, as empty, as not-self.

an4.126:1.5.pli: So kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā suddhāvāsānaṃ devānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjati.
an4.126:1.5.eng: When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in the company of the gods of the pure abodes.

an4.126:1.6.eng: This rebirth is distinct from that of ordinary people.

an4.126:2.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, idhekacco puggalo karuṇā …pe…
an4.126:2.1.eng: Furthermore, an individual meditates spreading a heart full of compassion …

an4.126:2.3.pli: upekkhāsahagatena cetasā ekaṃ disaṃ pharitvā viharati, tathā dutiyaṃ tathā tatiyaṃ tathā catutthaṃ. Iti uddhamadho tiriyaṃ sabbadhi sabbattatāya sabbāvantaṃ lokaṃ upekkhāsahagatena cetasā vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena abyāpajjena pharitvā viharati.
an4.126:2.3.eng: equanimity to one direction, and to the second, and to the third, and to the fourth. In the same way above, below, across, everywhere, all around, they spread a heart full of equanimity to the whole world—abundant, expansive, limitless, free of enmity and ill will.

an4.126:2.4.pli: So yadeva tattha hoti rūpagataṃ vedanāgataṃ saññāgataṃ saṅkhāragataṃ viññāṇagataṃ te dhamme aniccato dukkhato rogato gaṇḍato sallato aghato ābādhato parato palokato suññato anattato samanupassati.
an4.126:2.4.eng: They contemplate the phenomena there—included in form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness—as impermanent, as suffering, as diseased, as a boil, as a dart, as gloom, as an affliction, as alien, as breaking apart, as empty, as not-self.

an4.126:2.5.pli: So kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā suddhāvāsānaṃ devānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjati.
an4.126:2.5.eng: When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in the company of the gods of the pure abodes.

an4.126:2.6.eng: This rebirth is distinct from that of ordinary people.

an4.126:2.7.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasminti.
an4.126:2.7.eng: These are the four individuals found in the world.”

an4.127:0.3.eng: Incredible Things About the Realized One (1st)

an4.127:1.1.pli: “Tathāgatassa, bhikkhave, arahato sammāsambuddhassa pātubhāvā cattāro acchariyā abbhutā dhammā pātubhavanti.
an4.127:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, with the appearance of a Realized One, a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha, four incredible and amazing things appear.

an4.127:1.3.pli: Yadā, bhikkhave, bodhisatto tusitā kāyā cavitvā sato sampajāno mātukucchiṃ okkamati, atha sadevake loke samārake sabrahmake sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya appamāṇo uḷāro obhāso pātubhavati atikkammeva devānaṃ devānubhāvaṃ.
an4.127:1.3.eng: When the being intent on awakening passes away from the host of joyful gods, he’s conceived in his mother’s womb, mindful and aware. And then—in this world with its gods, Māras, and divinities, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, gods and humans—an immeasurable, magnificent light appears, surpassing the glory of the gods.

an4.127:1.4.pli: Yāpi tā lokantarikā aghā asaṃvutā andhakārā andhakāratimisā yatthapimesaṃ candimasūriyānaṃ evaṃmahiddhikānaṃ evaṃmahānubhāvānaṃ ābhā nānubhonti, tatthapi appamāṇo uḷāro obhāso pātubhavati atikkammeva devānaṃ devānubhāvaṃ.
an4.127:1.4.eng: Even in the boundless gloom of interstellar space—so utterly dark that even the luminosity of the moon and the sun, so mighty and powerful, makes no impression—an immeasurable, magnificent light appears, surpassing the glory of the gods.

an4.127:1.5.pli: Yepi tattha sattā upapannā tepi tenobhāsena aññamaññaṃ sañjānanti:
an4.127:1.5.eng: And the sentient beings reborn there recognize each other by that light:

an4.127:1.6.eng: ‘So, it seems other sentient beings have been reborn here!’

an4.127:1.7.pli: Tathāgatassa, bhikkhave, arahato sammāsambuddhassa pātubhāvā ayaṃ paṭhamo acchariyo abbhuto dhammo pātubhavati.
an4.127:1.7.eng: This is the first incredible and amazing thing that appears with the appearance of a Realized One.

an4.127:2.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, yadā bodhisatto sato sampajāno mātukucchimhā nikkhamati, atha sadevake loke samārake sabrahmake sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya appamāṇo uḷāro obhāso pātubhavati atikkammeva devānaṃ devānubhāvaṃ.
an4.127:2.1.eng: Furthermore, the being intent on awakening emerges from his mother’s womb, mindful and aware. And then … an immeasurable, magnificent light appears …

an4.127:2.2.pli: Yāpi tā lokantarikā aghā asaṃvutā andhakārā andhakāratimisā yatthapimesaṃ candimasūriyānaṃ evaṃmahiddhikānaṃ evaṃmahānubhāvānaṃ ābhā nānubhonti, tatthapi appamāṇo uḷāro obhāso pātubhavati atikkammeva devānaṃ devānubhāvaṃ.
an4.127:2.2.eng: even in the boundless gloom of interstellar space …

an4.127:2.3.pli: Yepi tattha sattā upapannā tepi tenobhāsena aññamaññaṃ sañjānanti:

an4.127:2.5.pli: Tathāgatassa, bhikkhave, arahato sammāsambuddhassa pātubhāvā ayaṃ dutiyo acchariyo abbhuto dhammo pātubhavati.
an4.127:2.5.eng: This is the second incredible and amazing thing that appears with the appearance of a Realized One.

an4.127:3.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, yadā tathāgato anuttaraṃ sammāsambodhiṃ abhisambujjhati, atha sadevake loke samārake sabrahmake sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya appamāṇo uḷāro obhāso pātubhavati atikkammeva devānaṃ devānubhāvaṃ.
an4.127:3.1.eng: Furthermore, the Realized One awakens to the supreme perfect awakening. And then … an immeasurable, magnificent light appears …

an4.127:3.2.pli: Yāpi tā lokantarikā aghā asaṃvutā andhakārā andhakāratimisā yatthapimesaṃ candimasūriyānaṃ evaṃmahiddhikānaṃ evaṃmahānubhāvānaṃ ābhā nānubhonti, tatthapi appamāṇo uḷāro obhāso pātubhavati atikkammeva devānaṃ devānubhāvaṃ.
an4.127:3.2.eng: even in the boundless gloom of interstellar space …

an4.127:3.3.pli: Yepi tattha sattā upapannā tepi tenobhāsena aññamaññaṃ sañjānanti:

an4.127:3.5.pli: Tathāgatassa, bhikkhave, arahato sammāsambuddhassa pātubhāvā ayaṃ tatiyo acchariyo abbhuto dhammo pātubhavati.
an4.127:3.5.eng: This is the third incredible and amazing thing that appears with the appearance of a Realized One.

an4.127:4.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, yadā tathāgato anuttaraṃ dhammacakkaṃ pavatteti, atha sadevake loke samārake sabrahmake sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya appamāṇo uḷāro obhāso pātubhavati atikkammeva devānaṃ devānubhāvaṃ.
an4.127:4.1.eng: Furthermore, the Realized One rolls forth the supreme Wheel of Dhamma. And then … an immeasurable, magnificent light appears …

an4.127:4.2.pli: Yāpi tā lokantarikā aghā asaṃvutā andhakārā andhakāratimisā yatthapimesaṃ candimasūriyānaṃ evaṃmahiddhikānaṃ evaṃmahānubhāvānaṃ ābhā nānubhonti, tatthapi appamāṇo uḷāro obhāso pātubhavati atikkammeva devānaṃ devānubhāvaṃ.
an4.127:4.2.eng: even in the boundless gloom of interstellar space …

an4.127:4.3.pli: Yepi tattha sattā upapannā tepi tenobhāsena aññamaññaṃ sañjānanti:

an4.127:4.5.pli: Tathāgatassa, bhikkhave, arahato sammāsambuddhassa pātubhāvā ayaṃ catuttho acchariyo abbhuto dhammo pātubhavati.
an4.127:4.5.eng: This is the fourth incredible and amazing thing that appears with the appearance of a Realized One.

an4.127:4.6.pli: Tathāgatassa, bhikkhave, arahato sammāsambuddhassa pātubhāvā ime cattāro acchariyā abbhutā dhammā pātubhavantī”ti.
an4.127:4.6.eng: With the appearance of a Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha, these four incredible and amazing things appear.”

an4.128:0.3.eng: Incredible Things About the Realized One (2nd)

an4.128:1.1.pli: “Tathāgatassa, bhikkhave, arahato sammāsambuddhassa pātubhāvā cattāro acchariyā abbhutā dhammā pātubhavanti.
an4.128:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, with the appearance of a Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha, four incredible and amazing things appear.

an4.128:1.3.eng: People like clinging, they love it and enjoy it.

an4.128:1.4.pli: sā tathāgatena anālaye dhamme desiyamāne sussūsati sotaṃ odahati aññā cittaṃ upaṭṭhapeti.
an4.128:1.4.eng: Yet when a Realized One is teaching the Dhamma of non-clinging, they want to listen, they actively listen, and they try to understand.

an4.128:1.5.pli: Tathāgatassa, bhikkhave, arahato sammāsambuddhassa pātubhāvā ayaṃ paṭhamo acchariyo abbhuto dhammo pātubhavati.
an4.128:1.5.eng: This is the first incredible and amazing thing that appears with the appearance of a Realized One.

an4.128:2.1.eng: People like conceit, they love it and enjoy it.

an4.128:2.2.pli: Sā tathāgatena mānavinaye dhamme desiyamāne sussūsati sotaṃ odahati aññā cittaṃ upaṭṭhapeti.
an4.128:2.2.eng: Yet when a Realized One is teaching the Dhamma of removing conceit, they want to listen, they actively listen, and they try to understand.

an4.128:2.3.pli: Tathāgatassa, bhikkhave, arahato sammāsambuddhassa pātubhāvā ayaṃ dutiyo acchariyo abbhuto dhammo pātubhavati.
an4.128:2.3.eng: This is the second incredible and amazing thing that appears with the appearance of a Realized One.

an4.128:3.1.eng: People like excitement, they love it and enjoy it.

an4.128:3.2.pli: Sā tathāgatena opasamike dhamme desiyamāne sussūsati sotaṃ odahati aññā cittaṃ upaṭṭhapeti.
an4.128:3.2.eng: Yet when a Realized One is teaching the Dhamma of peace, they want to listen, they actively listen, and they try to understand.

an4.128:3.3.pli: Tathāgatassa, bhikkhave, arahato sammāsambuddhassa pātubhāvā ayaṃ tatiyo acchariyo abbhuto dhammo pātubhavati.
an4.128:3.3.eng: This is the third incredible and amazing thing that appears with the appearance of a Realized One.

an4.128:4.1.eng: This population is lost in ignorance, swaddled in their shells.

an4.128:4.2.pli: Sā tathāgatena avijjāvinaye dhamme desiyamāne sussūsati sotaṃ odahati aññā cittaṃ upaṭṭhapeti.
an4.128:4.2.eng: Yet when a Realized One is teaching the Dhamma of removing ignorance, they want to listen, they actively listen, and they try to understand.

an4.128:4.3.pli: Tathāgatassa, bhikkhave, arahato sammāsambuddhassa pātubhāvā ayaṃ catuttho acchariyo abbhuto dhammo pātubhavati.
an4.128:4.3.eng: This is the fourth incredible and amazing thing that appears with the appearance of a Realized One.

an4.128:4.4.pli: Tathāgatassa, bhikkhave, arahato sammāsambuddhassa pātubhāvā ime cattāro acchariyā abbhutā dhammā pātubhavantī”ti.
an4.128:4.4.eng: With the appearance of a Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha, four incredible and amazing things appear.”

an4.129:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, there are these four incredible and amazing things about Ānanda.

an4.129:1.3.pli: Sace, bhikkhave, bhikkhuparisā ānandaṃ dassanāya upasaṅkamati, dassanenapi sā attamanā hoti.
an4.129:1.3.eng: If an assembly of monks goes to see Ānanda, they’re uplifted by seeing him

an4.129:1.4.pli: Tatra ce ānando dhammaṃ bhāsati, bhāsitenapi sā attamanā hoti.
an4.129:1.4.eng: and uplifted by hearing him speak.

an4.129:1.5.pli: Atittāva, bhikkhave, bhikkhuparisā hoti, atha ānando tuṇhī bhavati.
an4.129:1.5.eng: And when he falls silent, they’ve never had enough.

an4.129:2.1.pli: Sace, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniparisā ānandaṃ dassanāya upasaṅkamati, dassanenapi sā attamanā hoti.

an4.129:2.2.pli: Tattha ce ānando dhammaṃ bhāsati, bhāsitenapi sā attamanā hoti.

an4.129:2.3.pli: Atittāva, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniparisā hoti, atha ānando tuṇhī bhavati.

an4.129:3.1.pli: Sace, bhikkhave, upāsakaparisā ānandaṃ dassanāya upasaṅkamati, dassanenapi sā attamanā hoti.

an4.129:3.2.pli: Tatra ce ānando dhammaṃ bhāsati, bhāsitenapi sā attamanā hoti.

an4.129:3.3.pli: Atittāva, bhikkhave, upāsakaparisā hoti, atha ānando tuṇhī bhavati.

an4.129:4.1.pli: Sace, bhikkhave, upāsikāparisā ānandaṃ dassanāya upasaṅkamati, dassanenapi sā attamanā hoti.
an4.129:4.1.eng: or laywomen goes to see Ānanda, they’re uplifted by seeing him

an4.129:4.2.pli: Tatra ce ānando dhammaṃ bhāsati, bhāsitenapi sā attamanā hoti.
an4.129:4.2.eng: and uplifted by hearing him speak.

an4.129:4.3.pli: Atittāva, bhikkhave, upāsikāparisā hoti, atha ānando tuṇhī bhavati.
an4.129:4.3.eng: And when he falls silent, they’ve never had enough.

an4.129:4.4.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro acchariyā abbhutā dhammā ānande”ti.
an4.129:4.4.eng: These are the four incredible and amazing things about Ānanda.”

an4.13:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, there are these four right efforts.

an4.13:1.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu anuppannānaṃ pāpakānaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ anuppādāya chandaṃ janeti vāyamati vīriyaṃ ārabhati cittaṃ paggaṇhāti padahati;
an4.13:1.3.eng: A mendicant generates enthusiasm, tries, makes an effort, exerts the mind, and strives so that bad, unskillful qualities don’t arise.

an4.13:1.4.pli: uppannānaṃ pāpakānaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ pahānāya chandaṃ janeti vāyamati vīriyaṃ ārabhati cittaṃ paggaṇhāti padahati;
an4.13:1.4.eng: They generate enthusiasm, try, make an effort, exert the mind, and strive so that bad, unskillful qualities that have arisen are given up.

an4.13:1.5.pli: anuppannānaṃ kusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ uppādāya chandaṃ janeti vāyamati vīriyaṃ ārabhati cittaṃ paggaṇhāti padahati;
an4.13:1.5.eng: They generate enthusiasm, try, make an effort, exert the mind, and strive so that skillful qualities arise.

an4.13:1.6.pli: uppannānaṃ kusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ ṭhitiyā asammosāya bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya bhāvanāya pāripūriyā chandaṃ janeti vāyamati vīriyaṃ ārabhati cittaṃ paggaṇhāti padahati.
an4.13:1.6.eng: They generate enthusiasm, try, make an effort, exert the mind, and strive so that skillful qualities that have arisen remain, are not lost, but increase, mature, and are fulfilled by development.

an4.13:1.7.eng: These are the four right efforts.

an4.13:2.1.eng: By rightly striving, <j>they’ve crushed Māra’s sovereignty;

an4.13:2.2.eng: unattached, they’ve gone beyond  <j>the peril of birth and death.

an4.13:2.3.pli: Te tusitā jetvā māraṃ savāhiniṃ te anejā,
an4.13:2.3.eng: Contented and unstirred, they’ve vanquished Māra with his legions;

an4.13:2.4.eng: now they’ve gone beyond all Namuci’s forces, <j>they’re happy.”

an4.130:0.3.eng: Incredible Things About the Wheel-Turning Monarch

an4.130:1.1.pli: “Cattārome, bhikkhave, acchariyā abbhutā dhammā raññe cakkavattimhi.
an4.130:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, there are these four incredible and amazing things about a wheel-turning monarch.

an4.130:1.3.pli: Sace, bhikkhave, khattiyaparisā rājānaṃ cakkavattiṃ dassanāya upasaṅkamati, dassanenapi sā attamanā hoti.
an4.130:1.3.eng: If an assembly of aristocrats goes to see a wheel-turning monarch, they’re uplifted by seeing him

an4.130:1.4.pli: Tatra ce rājā cakkavattī bhāsati, bhāsitenapi sā attamanā hoti.
an4.130:1.4.eng: and uplifted by hearing him speak.

an4.130:1.5.pli: Atittāva, bhikkhave, khattiyaparisā hoti, atha rājā cakkavattī tuṇhī bhavati.
an4.130:1.5.eng: And when he falls silent, they’ve never had enough.

an4.130:2.1.pli: Sace, bhikkhave, brāhmaṇaparisā rājānaṃ cakkavattiṃ dassanāya upasaṅkamati, dassanenapi sā attamanā hoti.

an4.130:2.2.pli: Tatra ce rājā cakkavattī bhāsati, bhāsitenapi sā attamanā hoti.

an4.130:2.3.pli: Atittāva, bhikkhave, brāhmaṇaparisā hoti, atha rājā cakkavattī tuṇhī bhavati.

an4.130:3.1.pli: Sace, bhikkhave, gahapatiparisā rājānaṃ cakkavattiṃ dassanāya upasaṅkamati, dassanenapi sā attamanā hoti.

an4.130:3.2.pli: Tatra ce rājā cakkavattī bhāsati, bhāsitenapi sā attamanā hoti.

an4.130:3.3.pli: Atittāva, bhikkhave, gahapatiparisā hoti, atha rājā cakkavattī tuṇhī bhavati.

an4.130:4.1.pli: Sace, bhikkhave, samaṇaparisā rājānaṃ cakkavattiṃ dassanāya upasaṅkamati, dassanenapi sā attamanā hoti.
an4.130:4.1.eng: or ascetics goes to see a wheel-turning monarch, they’re uplifted by seeing him

an4.130:4.2.pli: Tatra ce rājā cakkavattī bhāsati, bhāsitenapi sā attamanā hoti.
an4.130:4.2.eng: and uplifted by hearing him speak.

an4.130:4.3.pli: Atittāva, bhikkhave, samaṇaparisā hoti, atha rājā cakkavattī tuṇhī bhavati.
an4.130:4.3.eng: And when he falls silent, they’ve never had enough.

an4.130:4.4.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro acchariyā abbhutā dhammā raññe cakkavattimhi.
an4.130:4.4.eng: These are the four incredible and amazing things about a wheel-turning monarch.

an4.130:5.1.pli: Evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, cattāro acchariyā abbhutā dhammā ānande.
an4.130:5.1.eng: In the same way, there are these four incredible and amazing things about Ānanda.

an4.130:5.3.pli: Sace, bhikkhave, bhikkhuparisā ānandaṃ dassanāya upasaṅkamati, dassanenapi sā attamanā hoti.
an4.130:5.3.eng: If an assembly of monks goes to see Ānanda, they’re uplifted by seeing him

an4.130:5.4.pli: Tatra ce ānando dhammaṃ bhāsati, bhāsitenapi sā attamanā hoti.
an4.130:5.4.eng: and uplifted by hearing him speak.

an4.130:5.5.pli: Atittāva, bhikkhave, bhikkhuparisā hoti, atha ānando tuṇhī bhavati.
an4.130:5.5.eng: And when he falls silent, they’ve never had enough.

an4.130:6.1.pli: Sace, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniparisā …pe… sace, bhikkhave, upāsakaparisā …pe… sace, bhikkhave, upāsikāparisā ānandaṃ dassanāya upasaṅkamati, dassanenapi sā attamanā hoti.
an4.130:6.1.eng: If an assembly of nuns … laymen … or laywomen goes to see Ānanda, they’re uplifted by seeing him

an4.130:6.2.pli: Tatra ce ānando dhammaṃ bhāsati, bhāsitenapi sā attamanā hoti.
an4.130:6.2.eng: and uplifted by hearing him speak.

an4.130:6.3.pli: Atittāva, bhikkhave, upāsikāparisā hoti, atha ānando tuṇhī bhavati.
an4.130:6.3.eng: And when he falls silent, they’ve never had enough.

an4.130:6.4.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro acchariyā abbhutā dhammā ānande”ti.
an4.130:6.4.eng: These are the four incredible and amazing things about Ānanda.”

an4.130:7.2.pli: dve ca nānā dve ca honti;

an4.131:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, these four individuals are found in the world.

an4.131:1.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekaccassa puggalassa orambhāgiyāni saṃyojanāni appahīnāni honti, upapattipaṭilābhiyāni saṃyojanāni appahīnāni honti, bhavapaṭilābhiyāni saṃyojanāni appahīnāni honti.
an4.131:1.3.eng: One individual hasn’t given up the lower fetters, the fetters for getting reborn, or the fetters for getting a continued existence.

an4.131:2.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekaccassa puggalassa orambhāgiyāni saṃyojanāni pahīnāni honti, upapattipaṭilābhiyāni saṃyojanāni appahīnāni honti, bhavapaṭilābhiyāni saṃyojanāni appahīnāni honti.
an4.131:2.1.eng: One individual has given up the lower fetters, but not the fetters for getting reborn, or the fetters for getting a continued existence.

an4.131:3.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekaccassa puggalassa orambhāgiyāni saṃyojanāni pahīnāni honti, upapattipaṭilābhiyāni saṃyojanāni pahīnāni honti, bhavapaṭilābhiyāni saṃyojanāni appahīnāni honti.
an4.131:3.1.eng: One individual has given up the lower fetters and the fetters for getting reborn, but not the fetters for getting a continued existence.

an4.131:4.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekaccassa puggalassa orambhāgiyāni saṃyojanāni pahīnāni honti, upapattipaṭilābhiyāni saṃyojanāni pahīnāni honti, bhavapaṭilābhiyāni saṃyojanāni pahīnāni honti.
an4.131:4.1.eng: One individual has given up the lower fetters, the fetters for getting reborn, and the fetters for getting a continued existence.

an4.131:5.1.pli: Katamassa, bhikkhave, puggalassa orambhāgiyāni saṃyojanāni appahīnāni, upapattipaṭilābhiyāni saṃyojanāni appahīnāni, bhavapaṭilābhiyāni saṃyojanāni appahīnāni?
an4.131:5.1.eng: What individual hasn’t given up the lower fetters, the fetters for getting reborn, or the fetters for getting a continued existence?

an4.131:5.3.pli: Imassa kho, bhikkhave, puggalassa orambhāgiyāni saṃyojanāni appahīnāni, upapattipaṭilābhiyāni saṃyojanāni appahīnāni, bhavapaṭilābhiyāni saṃyojanāni appahīnāni.
an4.131:5.3.eng: This is the individual who hasn’t given up the lower fetters, the fetters for getting reborn, or the fetters for getting a continued existence.

an4.131:6.1.pli: Katamassa, bhikkhave, puggalassa orambhāgiyāni saṃyojanāni pahīnāni, upapattipaṭilābhiyāni saṃyojanāni appahīnāni, bhavapaṭilābhiyāni saṃyojanāni appahīnāni?
an4.131:6.1.eng: What individual has given up the lower fetters, but not the fetters for getting reborn, or the fetters for getting a continued existence?

an4.131:6.2.eng: One heading upstream, going to the Akaniṭṭha realm.

an4.131:6.3.pli: Imassa kho, bhikkhave, puggalassa orambhāgiyāni saṃyojanāni pahīnāni, upapattipaṭilābhiyāni saṃyojanāni appahīnāni, bhavapaṭilābhiyāni saṃyojanāni appahīnāni.

an4.131:7.1.pli: Katamassa, bhikkhave, puggalassa orambhāgiyāni saṃyojanāni pahīnāni, upapattipaṭilābhiyāni saṃyojanāni pahīnāni, bhavapaṭilābhiyāni saṃyojanāni appahīnāni?
an4.131:7.1.eng: What individual has given up the lower fetters and the fetters for getting reborn, but not the fetters for getting a continued existence?

an4.131:7.2.eng: One extinguished between one life and the next.

an4.131:7.3.pli: Imassa kho, bhikkhave, puggalassa orambhāgiyāni saṃyojanāni pahīnāni, upapattipaṭilābhiyāni saṃyojanāni pahīnāni, bhavapaṭilābhiyāni saṃyojanāni appahīnāni.

an4.131:8.1.pli: Katamassa, bhikkhave, puggalassa orambhāgiyāni saṃyojanāni pahīnāni, upapattipaṭilābhiyāni saṃyojanāni pahīnāni, bhavapaṭilābhiyāni saṃyojanāni pahīnāni?
an4.131:8.1.eng: What individual has given up the lower fetters, the fetters for getting reborn, and the fetters for getting a continued existence?

an4.131:8.3.pli: Imassa kho, bhikkhave, puggalassa orambhāgiyāni saṃyojanāni pahīnāni, upapattipaṭilābhiyāni saṃyojanāni pahīnāni, bhavapaṭilābhiyāni saṃyojanāni pahīnāni.

an4.131:8.4.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmin”ti.
an4.131:8.4.eng: These are the four individuals found in the world.”

an4.132:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, these four individuals are found in the world.

an4.132:1.3.eng: One who speaks on topic, but not fluently.

an4.132:1.4.eng: One who speaks fluently, but not on topic.

an4.132:1.5.eng: One who speaks on topic and fluently.

an4.132:1.6.eng: One who speaks neither on topic nor fluently.

an4.132:1.7.pli: ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmin”ti.
an4.132:1.7.eng: These are the four individuals found in the world.”

an4.133:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, these four individuals are found in the world.

an4.133:1.3.eng: One who understands immediately, one who understands after detailed explanation, one who needs education, and one who merely learns by rote.

an4.133:1.4.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmin”ti.
an4.133:1.4.eng: These are the four individuals found in the world.”

an4.134:1.1.eng: “These four individuals are found in the world.

an4.134:1.3.eng: One who lives off the fruit of initiative, but not deeds;

an4.134:1.4.eng: one who lives off the fruit of deeds, but not initiative;

an4.134:1.5.eng: one who lives off the fruit of both deeds and initiative;

an4.134:1.6.eng: one who lives off the fruit of neither initiative nor deeds.

an4.134:1.7.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmin”ti.
an4.134:1.7.eng: These are the four individuals found in the world.”

an4.135:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, these four individuals are found in the world.

an4.135:1.3.eng: The blameworthy, the mostly blameworthy, the slightly blameworthy, and the blameless.

an4.135:2.1.eng: And how is an individual blameworthy?

an4.135:2.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo sāvajjena kāyakammena samannāgato hoti, sāvajjena vacīkammena samannāgato hoti, sāvajjena manokammena samannāgato hoti.
an4.135:2.2.eng: It’s when an individual does things by way of body, speech, and mind that are blameworthy.

an4.135:2.3.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo sāvajjo hoti.
an4.135:2.3.eng: That’s how an individual is blameworthy.

an4.135:3.1.eng: And how is an individual mostly blameworthy?

an4.135:3.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo sāvajjena bahulaṃ kāyakammena samannāgato hoti, appaṃ anavajjena;
an4.135:3.2.eng: It’s when an individual does things by way of body, speech, and mind that are mostly blameworthy, but occasionally blameless.

an4.135:3.3.pli: sāvajjena bahulaṃ vacīkammena samannāgato hoti, appaṃ anavajjena;

an4.135:3.4.pli: sāvajjena bahulaṃ manokammena samannāgato hoti, appaṃ anavajjena.

an4.135:3.5.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo vajjabahulo hoti.
an4.135:3.5.eng: That’s how an individual is mostly blameworthy.

an4.135:4.1.eng: And how is an individual slightly blameworthy?

an4.135:4.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo anavajjena bahulaṃ kāyakammena samannāgato hoti, appaṃ sāvajjena;
an4.135:4.2.eng: It’s when an individual does things by way of body, speech, and mind that are mostly blameless, but occasionally blameworthy.

an4.135:4.3.pli: anavajjena bahulaṃ vacīkammena samannāgato hoti, appaṃ sāvajjena;

an4.135:4.4.pli: anavajjena bahulaṃ manokammena samannāgato hoti, appaṃ sāvajjena.

an4.135:4.5.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo appavajjo hoti.
an4.135:4.5.eng: That’s how an individual is slightly blameworthy.

an4.135:5.1.eng: And how is an individual blameless?

an4.135:5.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo anavajjena kāyakammena samannāgato hoti, anavajjena vacīkammena samannāgato hoti, anavajjena manokammena samannāgato hoti.
an4.135:5.2.eng: It’s when an individual does things by way of body, speech, and mind that are blameless.

an4.135:5.3.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo anavajjo hoti.
an4.135:5.3.eng: That’s how an individual is blameless.

an4.135:5.4.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmin”ti.
an4.135:5.4.eng: These are the four individuals found in the world.”

an4.136:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, these four individuals are found in the world.

an4.136:1.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo sīlesu na paripūrakārī hoti, samādhismiṃ na paripūrakārī, paññāya na paripūrakārī.
an4.136:1.3.eng: One individual has not fulfilled ethics, immersion, or wisdom.

an4.136:2.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo sīlesu paripūrakārī hoti, samādhismiṃ na paripūrakārī, paññāya na paripūrakārī.
an4.136:2.1.eng: One individual has fulfilled ethics, but not immersion or wisdom.

an4.136:3.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo sīlesu paripūrakārī hoti, samādhismiṃ paripūrakārī, paññāya na paripūrakārī.
an4.136:3.1.eng: One individual has fulfilled ethics and immersion, but not wisdom.

an4.136:4.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo sīlesu paripūrakārī hoti, samādhismiṃ paripūrakārī, paññāya paripūrakārī.
an4.136:4.1.eng: One individual has fulfilled ethics, immersion, and wisdom.

an4.136:4.2.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmin”ti.
an4.136:4.2.eng: These are the four individuals found in the world.”
